{"step_by_step_thinking": "Yes, socioeconomic status can matter when it comes to the learning needs of postpartum women. Socioeconomic status can influence access to healthcare resources, education, and support systems. Women with lower socioeconomic status may have limited access to prenatal care, which can impact their knowledge and preparedness for the postpartum period. They may also have limited access to postpartum support services, such as lactation consultants or mental health professionals, which can affect their ability to learn and navigate the challenges of the postpartum period. Additionally, socioeconomic status can impact the social determinants of health, such as housing, nutrition, and stress levels, which can all influence a woman's ability to learn and adapt during the postpartum period.", "answer_choice": "A. yes"}
